# Discord Channel Analysis: "discussion"

## 1. Summary
The chat segment shows minimal technical discussion. The only technical content shared was a video about plugin development posted by Snapper. The conversation primarily consisted of casual exchanges, cryptocurrency tipping (using tip.cc bot to send ai16z tokens), sharing of tweets/links, and brief mentions of a project called "ai16z" which appears to be some form of cryptocurrency or token. There were references to "bookoftruth.xyz" website and mentions of open source initiatives related to ai16z. Overall, this chat segment lacks substantial technical discussions, problem-solving, or concrete implementations.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Just published a new video, Intro to Plugin Development: https://youtu.be/m_TlMWlg-oA (asked by Snapper) A: Unanswered
Q: is website ok? bookoftruth.xyz (asked by DONT CLICK I GOT HACKED) A: Unanswered
Q: how'd that happen (asked by whobody) A: Unanswered
Q: Hi @498273781589213185 you deployed a coin? (asked by Dylan) A: Unanswered
Q: Still no twitter page or am I missing sum (asked by styn) A: No x so far, sir (answered by Motzl)

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: Odilitime | Helpee: 1141507408078831777 | Context: Sending cryptocurrency tips | Resolution: Successfully sent 808.20 ai16z (â‰ˆ $100.00) after initial failed attempts
Helper: Motzl | Helpee: styn | Context: Question about existence of Twitter/X page | Resolution: Confirmed there was no X page yet

## 4. Action Items

# Discord Chat Analysis for ðŸ’»-coders

## 1. Summary
The chat segment contains minimal technical discussion. Snapper shared a video about plugin development. OpenRouter announced that GPT-5 is no longer restricted behind BYOK (Bring Your Own Key). Noah asked about deploying agents to run on cron jobs, specifically for the "sage" GitHub repository. Sayonara recommended Railway.com as a deployment option. Benquik inquired about using deep-seek LLMs with elizaos v1.4.2, to which Sayonara suggested using the OpenAI plugin with modified environment variables while noting the need for a separate embedding provider. Trixi asked about making an old Twitter plugin work with the latest plugin, but received no response.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Is there a recommendation on where to deploy agents to run on cron jobs? (asked by noah) A: railway.com (answered by sayonara)
Q: Is there a plugin on elizaos v 1.4.2 for deep-seek? (asked by Benquik) A: Use OpenAI plugin and change api key, base url and other env from deep seek. You will still need an embedding provider. (answered by sayonara)
Q: Has anyone made old twitter plugin made it work with latest plugin? (asked by Trixi) A: Unanswered

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: sayonara | Helpee: noah | Context: Looking for a place to deploy an agent (sage) to run on cron jobs | Resolution: Recommended railway.com as a deployment solution
Helper: sayonara | Helpee: Benquik | Context: Wanting to use deep-seek LLMs with elizaos v1.4.2 | Resolution: Suggested using OpenAI plugin with modified environment variables while noting the need for a separate embedding provider

## 4. Action Items
Technical: Explore using railway.com for agent deployment with cron jobs | Description: Deploy sage repository to run daily | Mentioned By: noah
Technical: Implement deep-seek LLMs with elizaos | Description: Modify OpenAI plugin with deep-seek credentials | Mentioned By: Benquik
Technical: Adapt old Twitter plugin to work with latest plugin | Description: Update compatibility for Twitter plugin | Mentioned By: Trixi

# Analysis of Discord Chat in "fun" Channel

## 1. Summary
The chat segment contains minimal technical discussion. Users reported a 404 error when clicking addresses in trade records on Auto.fun. There was mention of someone forking Auto.fun to build a version for the Italian market. The channel appears to have moderation that blocks links from unknown domains. The conversation was brief with limited technical substance and included some off-topic comments.

## 2. FAQ
Q: On Auto.fun, when I click an address in the trade records, it shows a 404 error. Is it just me? (asked by lfg) A: It does the same to me (answered by Marc30 / Arichain)
Q: I tried sending you the url for the resources you might need but it appears to be blocked so I send them to your in box. (asked by YVZPEEK) A: We block links from unknown domains (answered by Odilitime)

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: YVZPEEK | Helpee: Unspecified user | Context: Sharing resources via URL | Resolution: Sent resources via direct message after channel blocked the URL

## 4. Action Items
Technical: Fix 404 error when clicking addresses in trade records on Auto.fun | Description: Users experience 404 errors when clicking on addresses in trade records | Mentioned By: lfg
Feature: Italian market version of Auto.fun | Description: Fork of Auto.fun being built for the Italian market | Mentioned By: realmad

# Discord Chat Analysis - "core-devs" Channel

## 1. Summary:
The discussion primarily revolves around Eliza's architecture and development approach. CJFT emphasizes refocusing on core JavaScript functionality before server implementation, suggesting a separation of concerns where "ElizaOS" can run anywhere with server components being optional wrappers. There's discussion about creating React hooks for developers using Eliza server, with CJFT advocating for a consolidated approach rather than numerous separate hooks. Agent Joshua shares progress on building a TEE environment for testing trustless agents using flox for containerization, highlighting improved developer experience. The team also discusses EIP-8004, with Kenk mentioning an upcoming discussion with EIP authors. Other topics include making project starter templates available as GitHub templates and considerations about SDK development approaches.

## 2. FAQ:
Q: Thoughts on putting `project-starter`, `plugin-starter`, `project-tee-starter` as GitHub templates for easy forking? (asked by sayonara) A: That's a good idea (answered by Stan âš¡)
Q: Is this true [regarding Twitter post]? (asked by sayonara) A: Unanswered
Q: Should a side project be to bring back the idea of a VC fund? (asked by Borko) A: Unanswered
Q: Has Sol foundation supported us? (asked by sayonara) A: Unanswered
Q: Will Eliza in browser be a server that others can connect to? (asked by sayonara) A: No (answered by cjft)

## 3. Help Interactions:
Helper: cjft | Helpee: sayonara | Context: Discussion about React hooks implementation for Eliza | Resolution: CJFT explained architectural vision separating core JS functionality from server components, suggesting "useEliza" instead of multiple hooks
Helper: Agent Joshua â‚± | TEE | Helpee: Channel members | Context: TEE environment testing | Resolution: Shared approach using flox to simulate TEE environment for testing trustless agents with simplified deployment workflow
Helper: cjft | Helpee: Channel members | Context: Eliza architecture design | Resolution: Explained importance of focusing on core SDK development before server implementation, comparing to Mastra's approach

## 4. Action Items:
Technical: Implement browser compatibility by removing fs/crypto dependencies and client polyfills | Mentioned By: cjft
Technical: Create consolidated React hooks (useEliza) instead of multiple separate hooks | Mentioned By: cjft
Technical: Develop "ElizaOS" class to better construct agent functionality | Mentioned By: cjft
Technical: Focus on core SDK development before server implementation | Mentioned By: cjft
Feature: Convert project starter templates to GitHub templates for easier forking | Mentioned By: sayonara
Documentation: Provide feedback on EIP-8004 for upcoming discussion with authors | Mentioned By: Kenk
